IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH A SECONDARY EDUCATION IN AN ATMOSPHERE CONDUCTIVE TO LEARNING AND SOCIAL INTERACTION WITH OTHERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: IN 1850 FREDERICK GUNN ESTABLISHED A SCHOOL BASED ON THE BELIEF THAT STRENGTH OF CHARACTER WAS THE GOAL OF EDUCATION. TODAY, THE GUNNERY RESTS ON THE FOUR CORNERSTONES OF CHARACTER: SCHOLARSHIP, INTEGRITY, RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILTY. CHARACTER IS FORGED IN A COHESIVE, DIVERSE COMMUNITY INFORMED BY A CHALLENGING COLLEGE PREPARATORY CURRICULUM, A BROAD RANGE OF ATHLETIC, ARTISTIC AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES AND A FACULTY OF SCHOLARS AND COMMITTED EDUCATORS DEDICATED TO THE INTELLECTUAL AND ETHICAL DEVELOPMENT OF EVERY STUDENT. A GUNNERY GRADUATE IS A BROADLY EDUCATED, SOCIALLY RESPONSIBLE CITIZEN WITH TESTED BELIEFS, STRENGTH OF CHARACTER AND THE COURAGE TO ACT ON CONVICTIONS.
IRS990.Desc: THE PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES PROVIDED BY THE SCHOOL ARE THOSE ASSOCIATED WITH COLLEGE PREPARTORY INSTITUTIONS. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING STUDENTS A SECONDARY EDUCATION, DORMITORY SERVICES AND A SCHOOL STORE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR FINANCIAL AID, INSTRUCTION, PLANT OPERATIONS, DEBT SERVICE AND GENERAL SCHOOL PURPOSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIVIDUALS AWARDED ASSISTANCE ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN CERTAIN LEVELS OF ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE BASED ON THE SCHOOL'S POLICIES. THE SCHOOL MONITORS THE INDIVIDUALS TO INSURE THAT THEY MEET THOSE STANDARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REIMBURSES THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL FOR INCIDENTAL EXPENSES INCURRED IN CONNECTION WITH HIS DUTIES AS HEAD, WHICH CONTRIBUTE TO HIS PEAK PERFORMANCE AND IN SUPPORT OF HIS ROLE AS A PUBLIC SPOKESMAN, MAJOR GIFT CULTIVATOR, AND SOLICITOR OF THE SCHOOL. PERSONAL RESIDENCE IS PROVIDED AS A MANDATORY CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, AS HEAD, FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL, AS EMPLOYER, SUBJECT TO THE UNDERSTANDING THAT IT WILL BE USED FOR SCHOOL FUNCTIONS. THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL'S SPOUSE ACCOMPANIES THE HEAD ON ANY RELEVANT TRAVEL FOR SCHOOL EVENTS OR MEETINGS. THE SCHOOL PAYS FOR RELEVANT CLUB DUES FOR THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL BEARS THE COST FOR CLEANING ASSISTANCE IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OF THE HOUSE FOR SCHOOL ENTERTAINMENT, MEETINGS AND OTHER FUNCTIONS. TAX INDEMNIFICATION AND GROSS-UP PAYMENTS EXPLANATION THE SCHOOL MADE A PAYMENT OF THE TAX OBLIGATION ON BEHALF OF THE ALUMNI & DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR FOR A TAXABLE FRINGE BENEFIT REPORTED ON THE EMPLOYEE'S W-2.

IN 1850 FREDERICK GUNN ESTABLISHED A SCHOOL BASED ON THE BELIEF THAT STRENGTH OF CHARACTER WAS THE GOAL OF EDUCATION. TODAY, THE GUNNERY RESTS ON THE FOUR CORNERSTONES OF CHARACTER: SCHOLARSHIP, INTEGRITY, RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILTY. CHARACTER IS FORGED IN A COHESIVE, DIVERSE COMMUNITY INFORMED BY A CHALLENGING COLLEGE PREPARATORY CURRICULUM, A BROAD RANGE OF ATHLETIC, ARTISTIC AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES AND A FACULTY OF SCHOLARS AND COMMITTED EDUCATORS DEDICATED TO THE INTELLECTUAL AND ETHICAL DEVELOPMENT OF EVERY STUDENT. A GUNNERY GRADUATE IS A BROADLY EDUCATED, SOCIALLY RESPONSIBLE CITIZEN WITH TESTED BELIEFS, STRENGTH OF CHARACTER AND THE COURAGE TO ACT ON CONVICTIONS.
81 VOLUNTEERS HAVE WORKED WITH ADVANCEMENT (FUND RAISING) 5 VOLUNTEERS ARE ASSISTING IN THE ARCHIVES
A DRAFT IS DISTRIBUTED TO ALL TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH TIME FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENTS
ANNUALLY KEY EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS AND TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM.
THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL'S SALARY WAS DETERMINED BY A BOARD COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THIS COMMITTEE UTILIZED DATA REFLECTING SALARIES FOR HEADS OF SCHOOL AT COMPARABLE SCHOOLS.

THE SALARIES OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL ARE SET BY THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL, UTILIZING DATA REFLECTING SALARIES FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS AT COMPARABLE SCHOOLS, OFTEN IN CONSULTATION WITH THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND WITH OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS.
THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
